thread.title: Volkswagen looking into more models for emissions cheat devices
thread.title_full: Volkswagen looking into more models for emissions cheat devices

title: Volkswagen looking into more models for emissions cheat devices
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Oct 22, 2015, 12:33 BST - UK Markets close in 3 hrs 57 mins Volkswagen looking into more models for emissions cheat devices By Edward Swift | Sharecast – 27 minutes ago 136.9725 +3.8225 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Volkswagen (Other OTC: VLKAF - news ) is investigating more of its diesel engines to see if they contain emissions cheat devices, the BBC reported on Thursday. The German car giant admitted in September it had deliberately deceived officials about how much its diesel cars polluted using a defeat device in its engines. 
The BBC reported the company is now looking into older versions of EA 288 engines built to the "Euro 5" emissions standard to see if it has the cheat software installed. 
VW previously said about 11m of its EA 189 diesel engines built to the same emissions standard were fitted with the software. 
That number could grow substantially if more engines are found to be manipulating emissions test data. 
The BBC reported newer EA 288 cars built to the "Euro 6" standard are said not to be affected. 
The scandal has already led to a number of high-profile resignations including group chief executive Martin Winterkorn, and could cost the company anywhere between €23bn and €78bn, according to Credit Suisse (LSE: 0QP5.L - news ) .
